results.title: Play misty for me [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Daley, Universal Pictures, Malpaso Company and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: In this contemporary thriller, Clint Eastwood plays the popular California disc jockey, Dave Garland. On his radio show he repeatedly receives a phone request for “Play Misty for Me”, from a feminine voice. Garland meets the owner of the mysterious voice, Evelyn Draper, at a night spot he frequents. Unsuspecting, he takes her home with him and there the terror begins. Stars Jessica Walter, Donna Mills and John Larch. Photographed by Bruce Surtees. Screenplay by Jo Heims and Dean Riesner. “Misty” composed and performed by Erroll Garner.

results.title: Play Loud
results.brief_description:
The distinctive Australian ‘pub rock’ sound was born in the hotels and bars of our major cities in the 1970s.
In the Melbourne scene, the ‘beer barns’ of the suburbs were complemented by smaller, more intimate venues in the city and inner suburbs of Carlton, Richmond, Fitzroy and St Kilda.
This film - made in his student days by award-winning producer Daniel Scharf - presents a 1979 performance by the Melbourne band ‘Cuban Heels’ at one such venue, ‘Hearts’ in Carlton.
The atmosphere of alcohol, cigarette-smoke and youthful exuberance is captured by the camera as it wanders through the audience and lingers on the dancers.
On stage, the band (led by Steve Connolly, who was later the guitarist with Paul Kelly’s ‘Coloured Girls’ and ‘Messengers’ bands) sings a song that could only be a product of the 1970s - about ‘the system’ and the coming revolution.

results.title: Play it safe electrically
results.brief_description: Warns children of the dangers of flying kites near overhead power lines; shows the dangers of climbing trees through which power lines run; identifies electircal substations and notes the inherent dangers; illustrates the consequences of touching fallen power lines and notes the dangers of using electrical equipment near water. Suitable for secondary level and teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Play it again Sam
results.creator_credit: Arthur P. Jacobs, Paramount Pictures, Rollins-Joffe Productions and Herbert Ross
results.brief_description: Woody Allen plays Alan, a fanatical movie buff whose wife has just left him. He has an outrageous recurring hallucination of Humphrey Bogart coaching him on how to make it with the ladies. His married friends, Dick and Linda fix him up with several eligible young ladies, but his self-confidence is low and it makes for a series of hilarious tragi-comic scenes where he fails dismally at every attempt he makes to impress. Eventually he discovers that there has been one woman all along who is right for him - his best friend’s wife! The final scene is a brilliant spoof of “Casablanca”, complete with trench coats and heavy fog. Also stars Diane Keaton as Linda.

results.title: Play is the work of young children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Crommie and Crommie, David Crommie and Karen Crommie
results.brief_description: Lenore Wilson discusses her educational philosophy as she is shown working with children in groups and individually. Classroom scenes show the children working on a building project, moving freely around the room and acting out adult roles in their play.

results.title: Play in the snow
results.brief_description: Teaches good health habits and encourages wholesome social relationships by depicting the activities of three small children on several cold, winter days in a New England town. The children build a snowman, make snowballs and go coasting and skiing. In all these activities the children practice rules of safety and good sportsmanship.

results.title: Play better golf. Part II. Advanced
results.brief_description: Lloyd Mangrum, Sam Snead, Patty Berg and Jim Ferrier show applied techniques in overcoming hazards and obstacles likely to be encountered on the course - high grass, water hazards, tree blocks and sand traps. Special attention is paid to proper clubs, chip shots and putting.

results.title: Play better golf. Part I. Fundamentals
results.brief_description: Championship players, Lloyd Mangrum, Sam Snead, Patty Berg, and Jim Ferrier illustrate, by slow motion, sequences and close-ups, the three fundamentals of good golf - correct grip, aim and swing.

results.title: Play-clay
results.creator_credit: Mary Anna Winkler, Peter Erik Winkler and ACI Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “At Your Fingertips”.
Shows how flour, salt and water can be combined to make an inexpensive modelling clay. Explains how to make and decorate various things with it. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.
